body_html: It's hard to say without knowing how the graph was exported, but in your script you set is_training=False when creating the Slim model. This will create a different model with some training-only variables and ops removed, which can be important for good results when running the graph.
body_text: It's hard to say without knowing how the graph was exported, but in your script you set is_training=False when creating the Slim model. This will create a different model with some training-only variables and ops removed, which can be important for good results when running the graph.
body: It's hard to say without knowing how the graph was exported, but in your script you set `is_training=False` when creating the Slim model. This will create a different model with some training-only variables and ops removed, which can be important for good results when running the graph.
